perturbation.original_text: Customer or its designees shall, within a period of [* * *] after the date of physical receipt of any shipment of Product from Supplier, inspect the Product for any shortages or any defects or deviations of the Product Specifications (hereinafter "Out Of Specification") that would be apparent from visual inspections of the Product. In the event that Customer is of the opinion that the Product is Out Of Specification at the time of delivery, Customer shall, within [* * *] after the date of physical receipt of Product, provide Supplier with a written notice to reject the Product (a "Notice of Rejection"), which shall include a description of the grounds for rejection and copies of test reports and testing methodology conducted on the Product, if any. However, with respect to any Out Of Specification Product which would not be apparent from a reasonable visual inspection on delivery, including in the case of any hidden defects, such Notice of Rejection shall be provided to Supplier not later than [* * *]. The failure of Customer or its designees to notify Supplier of any Out Of Specification Product in the manner set forth herein above shall constitute confirmation of the acceptance thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Customer or its designees shall, within a period of 5 days after the date of physical receipt of any shipment of Product from Supplier, inspect the Product for any shortages or any defects or deviations of the Product Specifications (hereinafter "Out Of Specification") that would be apparent from visual inspections of the Product. In the event that Customer is of the opinion that the Product is Out Of Specification at the time of delivery, Customer shall, within 5 days after the date of physical receipt of Product, provide Supplier with a written notice to reject the Product (a "Notice of Rejection"), which shall include a description of the grounds for rejection and copies of test reports and testing methodology conducted on the Product, if any. However, with respect to any Out Of Specification Product which would not be apparent from a reasonable visual inspection on delivery, including in the case of any hidden defects, such Notice of Rejection shall be provided to Supplier not later than 10 days. The failure of Customer or its designees to notify Supplier of any Out Of Specification Product in the manner set forth herein above shall constitute confirmation of the acceptance thereof.
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the inspection and notification periods for defects, potentially violating the UCC's standard of 'reasonable time' for inspection and rejection, making it difficult for Customer to fully inspect and reject non-conforming goods. The original text had [* * *], making it ambiguous.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) Section 2-602, 2-606, Article 2 Sales

perturbation.original_text: Each invoice provided by Supplier to Customer under Section 10.1, to the extent accurate, shall be paid by Customer to Supplier within [* * *] after the date of the invoice to the extent that Customer does not reasonably dispute that portion of the invoice in good faith. All payments will be made in U.S. Dollars by SWIFT bank transfer directly to the Supplier account as specified in the respective Purchase Orders.
perturbation.changed_text: Each invoice provided by Supplier to Customer under Section 10.1, to the extent accurate, shall be paid by Customer to Supplier within 60 days after the date of the invoice to the extent that Customer does not reasonably dispute that portion of the invoice in good faith. All payments will be made in U.S. Dollars by SWIFT bank transfer directly to the Supplier account as specified in the respective Purchase Orders.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment term to 60 days, without knowing the industry standards or prior agreements, could violate prompt payment laws or industry norms for pharmaceutical manufacturing, especially if the original contract had a shorter, legally compliant timeframe. The original text had [* * *], making it ambiguous.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction - could violate prompt payment laws or breach of implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: Supplier shall maintain adequate books and records and retention samples consistent with cGMP Requirements and any other Applicable Law and requirements of applicable governmental or regulatory authorities, in respect of test records, samples and associated support data for all batches of Product Manufactured by Supplier sufficient to substantiate and verify Supplier's duties and obligations under this Agreement for [* * *] from the expiration date of the respective Product batch.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier shall maintain adequate books and records and retention samples consistent with cGMP Requirements and any other Applicable Law and requirements of applicable governmental or regulatory authorities, in respect of test records, samples and associated support data for all batches of Product Manufactured by Supplier sufficient to substantiate and verify Supplier's duties and obligations under this Agreement for one (1) year from the expiration date of the respective Product batch.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the record retention period to one year may violate FDA or EMEA regulations requiring longer retention for pharmaceutical products, making it difficult to prove compliance or address future safety concerns. The original text had [* * *], making it ambiguous.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 CFR Part 211.180 - FDA regulations on record retention for drug products.
